summary: The DeOndra Dixon INCLUDE Project Act of 2025 aims to authorize the Secretary of Health and Human Services to carry out a program of research, training, and investigation related to Down syndrome. The bill focuses on various aspects, including research on the effects of trisomy 21, clinical trials, and improving the quality of life for individuals with Down syndrome and their families. It mandates coordination between NIH institutes, consultation with stakeholders, and biennial reports to Congress.
